sense.name: the act of providing a clarifying account of something
sense.commentary: EXPLANATION[+action][+communication][+account][+clarifying] Note: implies an agent/actor performing a speech act, spoken or written Note: nominalization - his explanation of the accident -> he explained the accident
sense.examples: The professor's explanation of the chemical process confused some of the students. We owe Mary an explanation for why we missed the meeting. The judge listened carefully to the defendant's explanation of the accident. John's application was rejected without any explanation from the hiring committee.

sense.name: a rationale or reason for something
sense.commentary: EXPLANATION[+relation][+rationale] Note: an event, fact, belief, situation that is the reason or cause for something else Note: does not imply a speech act performed by an actor (Sense 1)
sense.examples: The birth rate is central to any explanation of population trends. Freud tried to make sex the explanation for all human behavior. His theory is not a convincing explanation of what is actually found in the fossil record. His deafness must be the explanation for why he didn't pick up the phone.
